result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Joel Stucki

defendant.name: Stucki, Michael Joel
defendant.address: No Permanent Address, La Crosse, WI

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on December 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

State by Strittmater /  Def in custody w/ Atty Rust
Stucki:  I had address change - JSS put memo in on Fri & I haven't heard anything back.  JSS verified my dad's address
Rust:  I haven't rec'd any communication from JSS - the Holiday has thrown some things off
Strittmater:  I have no objection to change of address - I would feel better if we had some verification from JSS w/ address & something stating that def can stay there...
Stucki:  JSS has verified it - I have just been waiting
CRT:  JSS TO SEND CRT A MEMO STATING THAT IT HAS BEEN VERIFIED THAT DEF CAN GO TO HIS FATHER'S HOUSE IN REDWING.  MR STUCKI TO DO APPLICATION FOR PUB DEF FOR CASES MR RUST IS UNABLE TO REPRESENT HIM ON

Def in custody w/Atty Springer
Pretrial report filed 
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination filed 
Def stands mute - not guilty plea entered.
Status: 10/20 @ 10 (EML)
PTCDA: 7/15 @ 1:30
$1000 sig bond set w/cond: no contact w/KS, comply w/JSS bail monitoring
Status conference on October 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
